result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mitchell L Perez

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: 11:29 AM Defendant Mitchell L Perez appears by video from Brown County Jail with attorney Breanna A. Halyburton appearing in person. Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State here for PH, believes it will be a waiver. Halyburton agrees, has not gotten a written form due to his incarceration, has went over his rights to PH verbally with him and Perez wanted to waive right to PH. Court goes over WOPH with Perez on the record, finds he is freely, voluntarily and intelligently waiving his right to PH, finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Information filed. Halyburton has received Information, waives reading and will proceed to ARGN, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas of NG, continues bond and will have set for JT.
Preliminary hearing on April 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

10:41 AM Attorney Breanna A. Halyburton in court.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Halyburton states the defendant is in Brown County and is currently quarantined, asks for an adjournment. Court will allow, continues bond, sets for PH on 4/25/22 at 3:00 PM.
Preliminary hearing on April 13, 2022 at 10:45 am.

09:03 AM Defendant Mitchell L Perez in court with attorney Breanna A. Halyburton.  Defendant Mitchell L Perez in custody and appears from Brown County Jail via video Zoom.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mitchell L Perez appeared by video means with Attorney. Halyburton and Perez have complaint, waives reading of it, requests PH within time limits. Court continues bond, sets for PH on 4/13/22 at 10:45 AM.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Per atty in Brown Co case (court appt atty) defendant has jury trial scheduled in approximately 2 weeks. He will let us know if convicted and remanded once trial is done.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:53 AM Defendant Mitchell L Perez appears by video.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions why he is appearing today without an attorney. Perez indicates unable to reach his attorney, left several messages/emails. Court questions if his attorney is SPD. Perez indicates he has a public defender in another county. Court advises he must call the SPD office to get an attorney appointed to him for this case, may not give him the same attorney as in his other case and advises of court appointed attorney if not eligible. Court will give him one last chance to appear with an attorney, continues bond and has set for AIA on April 6, 2022 at 9:00 AM.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 2, 2022 at 10:45 am.

10:03 AM Defendant Mitchell L Perez appears by video.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin appears by video. CC and CR appear by video. Perez indicates he has received a copy of his complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. Perez understands. Court questions if he has contacted at attorney. Perez has contacted an attorney, has not gotten back to him yet, Thomas Gentermen (?). Court will have set for AIA to allow time to get in contact with his attorney, continues bond and has set for AIA on 3/2/22 at 10:45 AM.

Called at 9:42 AM. FOSO Incident #2022-1314. State appears by Alexandr Seifert via Zoom. Court reporter is Kim Lentz. Defendant Perez appears via phone as he could not figure Zoom out. State has not filed a complaint yet stating they need more information prior to issuing a criminal complaint, asking for a one week adjournment and to continue bond. Court will allow that, continues bond, sets for INIT on 2/1/22 at 10:00 AM, must either get Zoom figured out or appear in person, confirms address and phone number.
